title: Web Engineering - Lecture 2 Quiz (HTML5 Essentials & CSS)

fill_in_the_blanks.question: HTML5 semantic elements clearly describe their purpose in human and ____-readable language.
Using semantic elements improves Accessibility, SEO, and ____.
The ____ tag defines a self-contained, independent piece of content like a blog post.
The ____ tag identifies content related to the primary content but not part of it, like author info.
The `<details>` tag is used with the ____ tag to provide a title for the disclosure widget.
The ____ tag is used to provide a caption for a `<figure>` element.
The ____ tag is used for self-contained content like illustrations or photos and doesn't affect the document flow if removed.
The ____ tag defines the footer section, which typically contains copyright and contact info.
The ____ tag defines the introductory or navigational content of a webpage, like a logo or search bar.
A document must not contain more than one ____ element.
The ____ tag is new in HTML5 and is used to highlight a part of the text.
The ____ tag is used to define navigation sections on a webpage, such as the main menu.
HTML5 forms are used to collect user ____ and send it to a server.
The `<input type="____">` is a new HTML5 input type for email addresses.
The `____` attribute in an HTML5 form specifies that a field must be filled out.
The `____` attribute provides a hint text inside an input field.
____ CSS involves applying styles directly to HTML elements using the `style` attribute.
Internal CSS is defined within the ____ tag in the `<head>` section.
External CSS files have a ____ extension and are linked using the `<link>` tag.
____ Layout is the default top-to-bottom arrangement of HTML elements.

true_false.question: Non-semantic elements like <div> clearly define their content and purpose.
Using semantic HTML can lead to better SEO because it’s easier for search engines to index.
An `<article>` tag can only be used once on a single webpage.
The `<aside>` tag is used to contain the main, primary content of the page.
The `<details>` tag is commonly used for creating FAQs or dropdown menus.
A `<figcaption>` element must always be placed *after* the content within a `<figure>`.
Removing a `<figure>` element from a document will not affect the document's flow.
The `<footer>` tag was added to HTML in 2014.
A single HTML document can contain multiple `<main>` elements.
The `<main>` element can be a child of an `<article>`, `<aside>`, `<footer>`, `<header>`, or `<nav>` element.
The `<mark>` tag is a new tag introduced in HTML5 to highlight text.
Using the `<nav>` tag helps improve accessibility for screen readers.
HTML5 forms increased the need for JavaScript for simple validation.
`placeholder` is a new input type in HTML5.
Using `type="tel"` on an input can show a specialized number keypad on mobile phones.
Inline CSS is the recommended method for styling large, multi-page websites.
Internal CSS is defined in a separate .css file.
External CSS can improve website performance by allowing the browser to cache the .css file.
Flexbox is an older layout method than Float Layout.
Grid Layout is a two-dimensional system, controlling both rows and columns.

mcqs.question: What is the primary benefit of using HTML5 semantic elements?
options: They automatically style the webpage with colors and fonts.
They clearly describe their purpose to both humans and machines.
They replace the need for CSS entirely.
They make the webpage load faster than non-semantic elements.
mcqs.answer: They clearly describe their purpose to both humans and machines.

mcqs.question: Which of the following is NOT listed as a reason to use semantic HTML?
Which semantic tag is best suited for a self-contained, independent piece of content like a blog post or news article?
What is the correct use of the `<aside>` tag?
options: To contain the main, dominant content of the page.
To hold content related to the primary content, but not part of it (e.g., a sidebar).
To define the footer of the page.
mcqs.answer: To hold content related to the primary content, but not part of it (e.g., a sidebar).

mcqs.question: Which tag creates a disclosure widget that the user can click to view or hide additional information?
The `<details>` tag is generally used in conjunction with which tag to provide its title or header?
Which tag is used to provide a caption or description for a `<figure>` element?
According to the lecture, what is the correct placement for a `<figcaption>` element?
options: It can be placed anywhere inside the `<body>`.
It must be the first or last child of the `<figure>` element.
It must be placed immediately *outside* the `<figure>` element.
It replaces the `alt` attribute on an image.
mcqs.answer: It must be the first or last child of the `<figure>` element.

mcqs.question: Which tag is new in HTML5 and used for self-contained content like illustrations, diagrams, or photos?
The `<footer>` tag typically contains all of the following EXCEPT:
options: The main navigation menu and logo
mcqs.answer: The main navigation menu and logo

mcqs.question: Which tag is a semantic element used to define the introductory content, often containing a logo, title, or search bar?
What is the rule for using the `<main>` tag in an HTML document?
options: A document can have unlimited <main> elements.
A document must not contain more than one <main> element.
A <main> element must be inside a `<footer>`.
A <main> element is required for every `<article>`.
mcqs.answer: A document must not contain more than one <main> element.

mcqs.question: The `<main>` tag should NOT be a child of which of the following elements?
options: <div> (that is not a child of article, aside, etc.)

mcqs.question: What does the HTML5 `<mark>` tag do?
options: Marks a section for deletion by the browser.
Defines the main content of the page.
Defines and highlights a part of the text.
mcqs.answer: Defines and highlights a part of the text.

mcqs.question: Which semantic tag is used to define a section of navigation links, such as a main menu or index?
Which of these elements was NOT in the list of fundamental HTML5 semantic elements?
What was a major improvement in HTML5 forms?
options: They removed all input types except 'text'.
They added new input types and built-in validation features.
They required all validation to be done with JavaScript.
They can only be styled using Inline CSS.
mcqs.answer: They added new input types and built-in validation features.

mcqs.question: Which of the following is a NEW input type introduced in HTML5?
Which HTML5 input type provides a slider control for selecting a value within a range?
Which input type, when used on a mobile phone, is likely to bring up a specialized number keypad?
Which input type provides a native color picker?
Which new HTML5 attribute specifies that an input field must be filled out before submitting?
Which attribute provides hint text *inside* an input field that disappears when the user starts typing?
Which HTML5 attribute allows you to specify a regular expression for an input field's value to be checked against?
Which attribute automatically places the cursor in a specific input field when the page loads?
What is a key benefit of HTML5 forms?
options: Built-in validation without needing JavaScript in many cases.
They only work on desktop computers.
They automatically connect to a SQL database.
They are harder for users to understand.
mcqs.answer: Built-in validation without needing JavaScript in many cases.

mcqs.question: What does CSS stand for?
What is CSS primarily used for?
options: To define the structure of a web page.
To style and control the layout and appearance of HTML elements.
To handle user input and form validation.
mcqs.answer: To style and control the layout and appearance of HTML elements.

mcqs.question: Which of the following is NOT one of the three types of CSS implementation?
How is Inline CSS applied to an HTML document?
options: Using a `<link>` tag to a .css file.
Using the `style` attribute directly on an HTML element.
mcqs.answer: Using the `style` attribute directly on an HTML element.

mcqs.question: When is it appropriate to use Inline CSS?
options: For styling an entire large-scale website.
For quick fixes or styling HTML emails.
As the primary method for maintainability.
When you want to use browser caching.
mcqs.answer: For quick fixes or styling HTML emails.

mcqs.question: How is Internal (Embedded) CSS implemented?
options: Using the `style` attribute on every element.
Inside a `<style>` tag, which is placed in the `<head>` section.
In a separate .css file linked via the `<body>`.
mcqs.answer: Inside a `<style>` tag, which is placed in the `<head>` section.

mcqs.question: What is an advantage of Internal CSS?
options: It is reusable across multiple pages.
It is the best for large-scale projects.
It styles only one element at a time.
It keeps HTML and CSS in the same file, which is easy for small projects.
mcqs.answer: It keeps HTML and CSS in the same file, which is easy for small projects.

mcqs.question: What is a major disadvantage of Internal CSS?
options: It is not reusable across multiple pages, increasing file size for larger sites.
It is too slow and blocks page rendering.
It cannot be used with semantic HTML tags.
It is applied using the `style` attribute.
mcqs.answer: It is not reusable across multiple pages, increasing file size for larger sites.

mcqs.question: When is Internal CSS most appropriate to use?
options: For large-scale projects with hundreds of pages.
When you need to override an external style for a single element.

mcqs.question: How is External CSS implemented?
options: Using the `style` attribute on the `<body>` tag.
Linking a separate `.css` file in the `<head>` using a `<link>` tag.
Writing CSS rules directly in an `<a>` tag.
mcqs.answer: Linking a separate `.css` file in the `<head>` using a `<link>` tag.

mcqs.question: What is a key advantage of External CSS?
options: It makes the HTML file larger.
It only works for one page at a time.
It improves performance via CSS caching and is maintainable.
It is best for quick fixes on a single element.
mcqs.answer: It improves performance via CSS caching and is maintainable.

mcqs.question: For large-scale projects, which CSS type is best for maintainability and scalability?
What is a 'layout' in web design?
options: The font and color scheme of a website.
The arrangement and structure of webpage elements (header, content, etc.).
The type of database used to store content.
The JavaScript functions used for interactivity.
mcqs.answer: The arrangement and structure of webpage elements (header, content, etc.).

mcqs.question: Which of the following is NOT one of the layout types mentioned in the lecture?
What is 'Normal Flow' layout?
options: The default top-to-bottom arrangement of HTML elements.
An old layout created using the `float` property.
A two-dimensional layout for rows and columns.
mcqs.answer: The default top-to-bottom arrangement of HTML elements.

mcqs.question: Which layout is an *older* method that uses the CSS `float` property to place elements side by side?
Which CSS layout system is designed to arrange elements in a single row or column in a flexible and responsive way?
Flexbox is described as working well for...
options: Old websites that do not need to be responsive.

mcqs.question: Which layout system is described as the 'most powerful' and 'two-dimensional (rows + columns)'?
What is Grid Layout best used for, according to the lecture?
According to the comparison table, which layout is best for 'Responsive sections'?
According to the comparison table, which layout is best for 'Full-page layouts'?
What CSS property and value are used to initiate a Flexbox layout on a container?
What CSS property and value are used to initiate a Grid layout on a container?
What is the primary difference between Flexbox and Grid?
options: Flexbox is one-dimensional (row OR column), while Grid is two-dimensional (rows AND columns).
Grid is an older technology than Flexbox.
Flexbox is for full-page layouts, while Grid is for navigation bars.
There is no significant difference; they are interchangeable.
mcqs.answer: Flexbox is one-dimensional (row OR column), while Grid is two-dimensional (rows AND columns).

mcqs.question: What does the `required` attribute do in an HTML5 form?
options: It provides a hint text inside the input field.
It specifies a regular expression for validation.
It automatically selects the field on page load.
It specifies that the field must be filled out.
mcqs.answer: It specifies that the field must be filled out.

mcqs.question: Which layout is described as the 'default top-to-bottom' arrangement?
Which tag is used to highlight text and is new in HTML5?
The lecture concludes that HTML5 and CSS3 provide the ____ for modern web development.
